title: run: Should a warning be issued when actual outputs do not match specified?

labels.name: cmd-run/rerun
labels.description: Issues about the favorite command of ReproPeople

body:
A complement to #3448 (globbing outputs post run): if user does specify some `--output`s but at the end we save more or completely different set of files, we have a "dichotomy" between expected and actual outputs.  Any later analysis of the "graph" would come to the same question -- should we take only the specified by user outputs, or factual ones, or the union? (may be user specified outputs were re-generated and just didn't differ from previous state).  
In `--explicit` mode only the user-specified outputs are saved, so it becomes an intersection of action + specified. In non`--explicit` mode I think it would be useful to forewarn (and ultimately allow to adjust/amend somehow) that specified `--output`s were not sufficient or were completely different.  For that to work re-globing of outputs should be done after run (thus relation to #3448)
